p: In the seedling evolution, ginger essential oil caused a significant dose-dependent inhibition of the hypocotyl development of P. oleracea, L. multiflorum, C. selloana, and N. glauca, reaching high reduction percentages of 82.74%, 66.85%, 73.68%, and 63.77%, respectively, at the highest dose (1 µL/mL) in comparison to the control ( Table 3). However, no significant reduction in E. crus-galli hypocotyl growth was observed at any dose assayed (0.125, 0.25, 0.50, and 1 µL/mL) with respect to the control ( Table 3, Figure 1C).
